page.title: 14WELLAND HOUSE
page.content: Welland house is an old folks residential house.Welland house was opened in December 1984.It is modern and has new facilities.There are 50 residents, who pay half of their pension to stay there,and 43 staff who organise activities such as bingo, card games and outings.There were also daily helpers and old folks from the northern area of Peterborough visited each day to be entertained and looked after.They were transported by ambulance.The home had its own hairdressing room and laundry room where a lady did the washing.Meals were cooked in a modern kitchen where there were big trolleys which kept food warm.Each flat consisted of a bed, chair, dressing table, sink and a comode.There was a sitting room where the guests can meet for a chat.The oldest resident is 98 years old.
